articles.title: Joe Biden Keeps Confusing Ukraine and Iraq
articles.author: Jordan Fabian
articles.excerpt: President Joe Biden slipped up twice in the last 24 hours by confusing the US war in Iraq with the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
articles.summary:
President Joe Biden slipped up twice in the last 24 hours by confusing the US war in Iraq with the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

Speaking to reporters Wednesday on the South Lawn of the White House, Biden said that Russian President Vladimir Putin had been weakened by a shocking mutiny by a mercenary group that's played a critical role in his war with Ukraine.

articles.title: Joe Biden Says Russia Is Losing In Iraq.....A Country It's Not At War With
articles.author: David Hookstead
articles.excerpt: President Joe Biden embarrassingly said Russia and Putin are losing a war against Iraq. Russia is at war with Ukraine. Watch the video.
articles.summary:
President Joe Biden made an embarrassing mistake Wednesday when talking about Russia and dictator Vladimir Putin.
 
Russia was briefly consumed by chaos late last week when Wagner Group boss Yevgeny Prigozhin 
appeared to be staging a coup
.
 
However, it didn't even make it through Saturday before the situation was resolved. Serious questions now linger about what happened following a deal being brokered between Putin and Prigozhin to avoid bloodshed.
 
What actually happened? How will it impact the war in Ukraine? Will Putin be impacted? Is he still in complete control?
 


Putin Vows To Crush Coup Attempt As Chaos Unfolds In Russia


 
Joe Biden incorrectly claims Russia is at war in Iraq.

articles.title: Kremlin hopes Biden meant to say Ukraine, not Iraq in verbal slip-up
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: Biden had said that Russian President Vladimir Putin was "losing the war in Iraq" when he meant to say Ukraine.
articles.summary:
The Kremlin said on Thursday it hoped that U.S. President Joe Biden had meant to say Ukraine rather than Iraq when he made a verbal slip-up on Wednesday.


Biden had said that Russian President Vladimir Putin was 'losing the war in Iraq' when he meant to say Ukraine.

articles.title: "Bro is living in another universe": Joe Biden says Putin is losing the war in Iraq, triggers online trolling
articles.author: Nikita Nikhil
articles.excerpt: American President Joe Biden was trolled online after he had yet another verbal slip-up, this time while speaking about Russian President Vladimir Putin.
articles.summary:
American President Joe Biden was trolled online after he had yet another verbal slip-up, this time while speaking about Russian President Vladimir Putin. On June 27, the 80-year-old politician was speaking to reporters before leaving for a White House-related trip to Chicago. There he was asked if Putin had been slowed down by the Wagner's group's chief, who had been revolting against the Russian authorities.

"It's hard to tell really. But he's clearly losing the war in Iraq. He's losing the war at home and he has become a bit of a pariah around the world.

articles.title: ‘It's hard to tell, but Putin's clearly losing the war..': Says Biden
articles.author: Arya S Nair
articles.excerpt: Washington: US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that ‘pariah' Vladimir Putin is ‘losing' the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether | DH Latest News, DH NEWS, US, Latest News, NEWS,…
articles.summary:
Washington: US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that ‘pariah' Vladimir Putin is ‘losing' the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether the Russian president has been weakened by the mercenary Wagner group's aborted rebellion.
 
Asked by reporters at the White House whether President Putin is now weaker, Joe Biden said: ‘It's hard to tell, but he's clearly losing the war' in Ukraine and ‘he's losing the war at home'. Vladimir Putin is now ‘a pariah around the world', President Biden added.

articles.title: Biden: ‘Pariah' Putin losing Ukraine war, but hard to tell if mutiny weakened him
articles.author: If Storyparsed.Issaf
articles.excerpt: US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that Russian President Vladimir Putin has become "a pariah" around the world but it is hard to say if he has been weakened by recent events involving the head of…
articles.summary:
News 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Published 
 June 28, 2023 11:25pm 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
US President Joe Biden said Putin was clearly losing the war in Ukraine and "he's losing the war at home, and he has become a bit of a pariah around the world." REUTERS/ Jonathan Ernst/ File photo
 
 
 
 
 WASHINGTON — US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that Russian President Vladimir Putin has become "a pariah" around the world but it is hard to say if he has been weakened by recent events involving the head of the militant Wagner Group.

articles.title: Joe Biden says Vladimir Putin is 'losing the war in IRAQ' in major gaffe
articles.author: Vassia Barba
articles.excerpt: US President Joe Biden confused the war in Ukraine with the 'war in Iraq' in a latest gaffe in front of reporters outside the White House, while speaking about Russia and Vladimir Putin
articles.summary:
US President Joe Biden confused the war in Ukraine with the 'war in Iraq' in a latest gaffe in front of reporters outside the White House, while speaking about Russia and Vladimir Putin
Joe Biden has said that Vladimir Putin is "clearly losing the war in Iraq" in another bizarre gaffe from the 80-year-old US President.
Mr Biden was asked by reporters outside the White House about the Wagner revolt that shook the Kremlin, and to what extent it has hurt Putin.
But Mr Biden didn't correct himself after replying: "It's hard to tell, but he's clearly losing the war in Iraq.

articles.title: Biden says Putin 'clearly losing' Ukraine war
articles.author: The Peninsula Newsper
articles.excerpt: Washington: US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that pariah Vladimir Putin is losing the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether the...
articles.summary:
US President Joe Biden speaks to the press as he departs from the South Lawn at the White House in Washington, DC, on June 28, 2023. (Photo by Jim WATSON / AFP)



Washington: US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that "pariah" Vladimir Putin is "losing" the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether the Russian president has been weakened by the mercenary Wagner group's aborted rebellion.


Asked by reporters at the White House whether Putin is now weaker, Biden said: "It's hard to tell, but he's clearly losing the war" in Ukraine and "he's losing the war at home.

articles.title: Kremlin hopes Biden meant to say Ukraine, not Iraq in verbal slip-up
articles.excerpt: In a verbal slip-up US President Joe Biden says Russian President Vladimir Putin was 'losing the war in Iraq' when he meant to say Ukraine
articles.summary:
U.S. President Joe Biden salutes as he boards Marine One to return to the White House, at Joint Base Andrews, Maryland, U.S., June 28, 2023. 
 
 REUTERS/Leah Millis 
 
 


 
 
 
In a verbal slip-up US President Joe Biden says Russian President Vladimir Putin was 'losing the war in Iraq' when he meant to say Ukraine
 


 
 
MOSCOW, Russia – The Kremlin said on Thursday, June 29, it hoped that U.S. President Joe Biden had meant to say Ukraine rather than Iraq when he made a verbal slip-up on Wednesday.

articles.title: US President Joe Biden Has Slip of Tongue, Says Russian President Vladimir Putin Is 'Losing the War in Iraq' (Watch Videos)
articles.author: Team Latestly
articles.excerpt: Joe Biden meant to say Ukraine, however, he had a verbal slip and said that Putin is losing the war in Iraq. The US President also said that Vladimir Putin has become "a pariah" around the world.…
articles.summary: In what can be seen as a verbal slip, US President Joe Biden said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "losing the war in Iraq". Joe Biden meant to say Ukraine, however, he had a verbal slip and said that Putin is losing the war in Iraq. The US President also said that Vladimir Putin has become "a pariah" around the world. Biden made the statement when he was asked if the Russian President had been weakened by the Wagner Group's revolt, which had been fighting against Ukraine. "It's hard to tell really.

articles.title: ‘Pariah' Putin ‘clearly losing' Ukraine war: Biden

articles.excerpt: US President Joe Biden says 'pariah' Vladimir Putin is losing his war in Ukraine - Copyright AFP Jim WATSONUS President Joe Biden said Wednesday that 'pariah' Vladimir Putin is 'losing' the war in…
articles.summary:
US President Joe Biden says 'pariah' Vladimir Putin is losing his war in Ukraine - Copyright AFP Jim WATSON
US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that 'pariah' Vladimir Putin is 'losing' the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether the Russian president has been weakened by the mercenary Wagner group's aborted rebellion.


Asked by reporters at the White House whether Putin is now weaker, Biden said: 'It's hard to tell, but he's clearly losing the war' in Ukraine and 'he's losing the war at home.

articles.title: 'Pariah' Putin 'clearly losing' Ukraine war: Biden
articles.author: AFP News
articles.excerpt: US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that "pariah" Vladimir Putin is "losing" the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether the Russian president has been weakened by the mercenary Wagner…
articles.summary:
US President Joe Biden says 'pariah' Vladimir Putin is losing his war in Ukraine


AFP News




US President Joe Biden said Wednesday that "pariah" Vladimir Putin is "losing" the war in Ukraine, but it is too early to tell whether the Russian president has been weakened by the mercenary Wagner group's aborted rebellion.
Asked by reporters at the White House whether Putin is now weaker, Biden said: "It's hard to tell, but he's clearly losing the war" in Ukraine and "he's losing the war at home."
Putin is now "a pariah around the world," Biden added.

articles.title: Joe Biden Says Putin Is ‘Clearly Losing the War in Iraq' (VIDEO)
articles.author: The Hill
articles.excerpt: President Biden this week mistakenly referred to Ukraine as Iraq on two occasions.
articles.summary:
President Biden this week mistakenly referred to Ukraine as Iraq on two occasions, mixing up the names of recent areas of conflict.


Biden was asked Wednesday to what extent Russian President Vladimir Putin has been weakened by the aborted rebellion in Russia. In his response, he switched out Ukraine for the war that started with a U.S.-led coalition invasion into Iraq and ended in 2011.




"It's hard to tell but he's clearly losing the war in Iraq."


US President Joe Biden misspoke saying Iraq rather than Ukraine when responding to questions about Vladimir Putin.

articles.title: US President Joe Biden mistakenly says Putin losing 'war in Iraq'
articles.author: 9News Australia
articles.excerpt: US President Joe Biden has been caught on camera in another awkward communication blunder. 9News
articles.summary:
U﻿S President Joe Biden has been caught on camera in another awkward pronunciation blunder, mistakenly referring to the "war in Iraq" instead of Ukraine. . Biden told CNN on Wednesday his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin has "absolutely" been weakened by the short-lived mutiny over the weekend. Asked whether the Russian president had been weakened, Biden said: "Absolutely.
"
"It's hard to tell but he's clearly losing the war in Iraq" Biden told reporters on the White House South Lawn, mistakenly referring to the war in Iraq instead of Ukraine.
